Description: Textile (garment?); fragment of plain undyed linen (a) edged with a band of pink silk (b); outer edge turned under. (a) undyed linen; simple tabby Warp: Z-spun, ca 40 ends/cm Weft: mainly S-, some Z-spun, ca 24 picks/cm Edges: all cut Swing: S-spun Z-ply linen threads, running stitch and overcasting joining (a) and (b). (b) band of cherry pink silk, originally a border to a larger cloth partly of undyed linen; outer edge and one end turned under. Simple tabby and warp-faced simple tabby Warp: Z-twist silk, ca 90 ends/cm, S-spun linen, ca 35 ends/cm Weft: Z-spun linen, ca 20 picks/cm Edges: one plain selvedge, other edges cut Swing: S-spun Z-ply linen threads, running stitch and overcasting joining (a) and (b).
Curator's comments: History of use: probably from clothing. (b) probably sewn to (a) as a re-use. Pre-acquisition history: edges away from band cut since finding. H. Granger-Taylor, 20/09/1989
